name: Hotel Antumalal

reviews.text: This hotel is true gem. The setting is gorgeous, the rooms are cozy with expansive lake views and a fireplace, the restaurant's food is delicious, and the common areas are perfect for lounging around in front of the fire with a glass of wine. Although we visited the lake region before the weather was such that activities in the lake were possible, there are so many other things to do in the area (hiking, thermal springs, horseback riding, etc.) and the staff is more than happy to give advice and help with arrangements. Furthermore, the hotel's price is very reasonable for the fabulousness of the place. If you are considering staying here, you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The antumalal has one of the most magnificent views for a hotel- every room looks out on scenery which would compete with a swiss alpine scene; beautiful lake, snow capped peaks etc. Our room was a little small but entirely comfortable and with character. We found the relative isolation was what made the place....and Pucon centre was an easy enough walk away (around 1/2 hr) and an easier taxi ride. The hotel gardens are beautiful and really relaxing to sit in and walk around and you get a view of the volcano from the edge of the property .
reviews.title: Let down by the service
Wow, what a place
reviews.text: However, what should have been a perfect experience was undermined by the service at the hotel. We stayed 3 nights and we found every encounter with the restaurant, including the room service, really frustrating. The wait staff disappeared for extraordinarily long periods of time while we all sat around waiting to order; breakfast would be packed up well in advance of closing time and would have to be unpacked for us and a number of other couples; we are still waiting for the simple food and drink order on our last day there- empanadas and sprite didnt arrive after 50 minutes, even after a couple of reminders that we needed to go to the airport- so we had to cancel and go hungry. A couple of the days they had buffet rather than al a carte and even still 2 wait staff just could not cope with relatively few guests and management did not seem to assist when needed.

We knew some rudimentary spanish but the room service staff knew no english- which I found surprising for a hotel which has about 80% of its guests from overseas; ordering 3 courses and drinks over the phone started having echoes of Fawlty Towers. There are some other niggles with this hotel which undermined our stay, including a hotel employee pushing on us views on immigration which we did not appreciate, and therefore what should have been a perfect stay became a so-so experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic Getaway
Wonderful!
reviews.text: Fall (May) in the South of Chile can be cold and rainy, but who would care at the Hotel Antumalal? This hotel, built in the 50's, has the most incredible modern style. All rooms have fireplaces, beautiful baths, and a view of the lake to die for. Then again, the pool and spa area with the calico cat that is the receptionist!
We stayed here at the very end of the high season, so it was still quite warm, and a lot less people.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful, and the staff was very helpful and friendly. It is located somewhat farther from the center of town, but we actually walked from the hotel to the center of town to dinner, and took a cab back after dinner. A cab ride was only about $5 US, so very inexpensive.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but bad location and horrible service

reviews.text: The outdoor pool is gorgeous, however, there were lots of bees flying around, and made it impossible to eat or drink anything for fear of being stung.
reviews.title: ultra-romantic, very cozy!

reviews.text: Breakfast was somewhat disappointing, but we were the only ones eating breakfast while looking out on some spectacular lake views.
reviews.title: Antumalal - Highly recommended

reviews.text: Getting to any of the hot springs is difficult. The hotel will arrange for a driver for you, but we had a rental car, and the main road to Huife was closed, so we found ourselves off-roading in a tiny rental car.
reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise, Altumalal

description: More than just a place to sleep, the Antumalal offers an unforgettable experience. Building began in 1945 fusing vanguard architectural forms with functionality and complete integration with the surroundings. To this day the unique character has been preserved, and all areas offer the amenities of a luxurious boutique hotel. Each of the 22 rooms is paneled with local wood and stone and all materials and furnishings are locally made. The panoramic windows look out over the private park and lake instigating a feeling of calm and total rest.
